      • Fields inherited from interface com.bigdata.rdf.sparql.ast.eval.AST2BOpBase.Annotations

    • Field Detail

      • OPTIMISTIC

        static final String OPTIMISTIC
        The value of this query hint determines how optimistic the optimizer will be in selecting the join cardinality for its joins. Basically when there is a join that has both shared and unshared variables, the join cardinality will be somewhere in between the cardinality of the two sides (range count for a statement pattern, previous join cardinality for a predecessor join). The default value is 1.0, which is the historical behavior.

        For a value of 0.67 the optimizer takes a mostly optimistic view by default - the join cardinality will be 0.67 * the MIN + 0.33 * the MAX. This settting will eliminate some of the worst possible outcomes (ones where we guess wrong and get a very bad join order as a result).

        BSBM BI Q1 is a good example of a query that benefits from the pessimistic approach, and LUBM Q2 is a good example of a query that benefits from the optimistic approach.

      • DEFAULT_OPTIMISTIC

        static final Double DEFAULT_OPTIMISTIC
        See OPTIMISTIC.
